content:
• Thursday, March 9, 2017
  • SBGI

    Sinclair Broadcast Group prices offering at $42/share

    • Sinclair Broadcast Group (SBGI +3.1%) has priced a public offering of 12M shares at $42/share.
    • Underwriters will get a 30-day greenshoe option to buy up to 1.8M more primary Class A shares on the same terms.
    • The company had filed information about the offering with the intent to use proceeds to "fund future potential acquisitions" and for general purposes -- interesting as the close of the FCC's spectrum auction will free up a number of firms for deal discussions.
    • Shares are off 0.4% after hours, to $42.75.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:24 PM | 1 Comment
  • MDP

    WSJ: Najafi/P-E group among bidders for Time

    • A group including Jahm Najafi and private-equity firm Pamplona Capital Management is among bidders for Time Inc. (TIME +1.9%), The Wall Street Journal reports.
    • The process is moving along toward completion even with the dropout of Edgar Bronfman Jr.'s group. The board has reportedly been discussing valuation in five bids. Final offers are due within two weeks.
    • Najafi tried (but failed) to buy Borders Group in 2011, and an affiliate bought self-publishing company Author Solutions from Bertelsmann's Penguin Random House in December 2015.
    • Previously: Time +2.4% on reports its buyout price is over $20 (Mar. 09 2017)
    • Previously: Reports: Bronfman group drops out of bidding for Time Inc. (Mar. 08 2017)
     
     
     
     
    | 7:19 PM | 5 Comments
  • FLNT

    Cogint up 8.2% as Q4 tops expectations

    • Cogint (COGT) is up 8.2% in postmarket trading after posting Q4 earnings that beat expectations on top and bottom lines (one estimate on EPS) during a year of transformation and acquisitions for the former IDI.
    • Revenue grew 400% on a Y/Y basis, but compared to Q3, it increased to $54.2M from $52.2M. Information Services revenue rose to $16.2M from $14.8M, and Performance Marketing revenue rose to $38M from $37.4M. The company's gross profit margin increased to 33% from 24%.
    • Net loss narrowed to $5.4M, from a loss of $9.7M.
    • Revenue by segment (Y/Y): Information Services, $55.4M (up from $6.4M); Performance Marketing, $131.4M (up from $7.7M).
    • It's boosting its 2017 revenue outlook to $233M-$239M -- up from previous guidance for $230M-$235M, and vs. consensus for $235.1M.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 7:01 PM | 3 Comments
  • OOMA

    Ooma drops further on secondary from top shareholder

    • Shares in Ooma (OOMA -8.2%) are another 1.1% lower after hours following news of a secondary offering where its top shareholder is unloading 2.861M shares.
    • Worldview Technology Partners will sell the shares between $8.75 and $9.00, Bloomberg reports. Ooma closed at $9 today.
    • The firm held a 19.1% stake in Ooma as of Jan. 19; the 2.861M shares make up more than 83% of its holdings of Ooma.
    • Underwriters have a 30-day option to buy up to an additional 429,193 shares from Worldview. The offering's expected to close next Wednesday.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:37 PM | 2 Comments

  • After Hours Gainers / Losers

    • Top gainers, as of 5.25 p.m.: COGT +8.2%. CRIS +6.2%. EXK +3.0%. SVNT +2.8%. PAY +2.2%.
    • Top losers, as of 5.25p.m.: FNSR -19.5%. SGRY -14.1%. ZUMZ -11.7%. CARA -5.3%. OCLR -5.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:36 PM
  • SALM

    Salem Media +2.2% as revenue grows across the board

    • Salem Media Group (NASDAQ:SALM) is up 2.2% after hours following Q4 earnings that beat expectations with the help of solid sales growth in its digital media arm.
    • Net income decreased to $3M from $5.3M, though; total operating expenses rose 12.3% to $67.2M, while revenues grew 2.2% to $70.7M.
    • EBITDA fell to $9.8M, missing an expected $12M.
    • Revenue by segment: Broadcast, $52.25M (up 1.3%); Digital media, $12.72M (up 6.9%); Publishing, $5.7M (up 1%).
    • It's guiding to Q1 revenue to be flat to 2% higher Y/Y -- $64.6-$65.9M, vs. consensus for $67.4M.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:13 PM
  • DFBG-OLD

    Differential Brands reports Q4 results

    • Differential Brands (NASDAQ:DFBG-OLD): Q4 EPS of -$0.37
    • Revenue of $42M (+106.9% Y/Y)
    • Shares +2.9% AH.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 5:10 PM
  • ZUMZ

    Zumiez -12%; FY 2017 outlook below expectations

    • Q4 2016 results – revenue $263.6M (+8.7% Y/Y, $3M above estimates), EPS $0.74 ($0.08 above estimates), comparable sales +5.1% Y/Y, net income $18.2M (+38.3% Y/Y)
    • FY 2017 projections [based on 0%-2% Y/Y comparable sales growth anticipated for Q1] – revenue $178M-$182M (consensus $185.93M), EPS -$0.17 to -$0.21 (consensus -$0.03), opening of 18 new stores (inclusive of up to 3 in Canada, 4 in Europe and 2 in Australia)
    • After hours – (NASDAQ:ZUMZ) $18.50
    • Press release / conference call / 8-K
     
     
     
     
    | 5:06 PM
  • SGRY

    Surgery Partners Q4 top line up 16%; earnings flat; cash flow ops up 34%; soft guidance sinks shares, down 14%

    • Surgery Partners (NASDAQ:SGRY) Q4 results ($M): Revenues: 306.0 (+16.2%); Surgical Facility Services: 275.8 (+14.8%).
    • Net Income: 16.9 (+0.7%); EPS: 0.35 (unch); Non-GAAP EPS: 0.19 (-66.7%); Non-GAAP EBITDA: 50.1 (+14.4%); Cash Flow Ops: 32.4 (+33.9%).
    • 2017 Guidance: Revenue growth: 9 - 11%; EBITDA growth: 10 - 15%. Consensus views on revenue ($1.3B) and EBITDA ($220M) imply growth of 13% and 23%, respectively.
    • Shares are down 14% after hours on light volume.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:58 PM | 2 Comments
  • MEET

    MeetMe -10.3%; public common stock offering of unspecified size proposed

    • Intended for working capital and other general corporate purposes, prospectively inclusive of financing for pending acquisition of if(we), a deal which had been disclosed concurrent with Q4 2016 earnings reported Monday.
    • MeetMe (NASDAQ:MEET) $5.21 after hours.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:46 PM | 28 Comments
  • XTNT

    Xtant Medical misses by $0.01, beats on revenue

    • Xtant Medical (NYSEMKT:XTNT): Q4 EPS of -$0.31 misses by $0.01.
    • Revenue of $24.5M (+10.0% Y/Y) beats by $0.28M.
    • Shares +1.6% AH.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:38 PM | 5 Comments
  • ISR

    IsoRay settles class action suit for $3.5M; shares ahead 15% after hours

    • Thinly traded nano cap IsoRay (NYSEMKT:ISR) is up 15% after hours, albeit on only 420 shares, in response to its announcement that a Washington district court has approved the settlement of a securities class action lawsuit. The company has agreed to pay $3,537,500 to settle the matter.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:33 PM
  • OCLR

    Optical component makers reduce after hours subsequent negative Finisar reporting

    • Notable – Oclaro (NASDAQ:OCLR) -5.74%, Lumentum Holdings (NASDAQ:LITE) -4%, Applied Optoelectronics (NASDAQ:AAOI) -2.3%, Acacia Communications (NASDAQ:ACIA) -2.15%, Fabrinet (NYSE:FN) -1.25%,  NeoPhotonics (NYSE:NPTN) -1.14%
    • Earlier (March 9, 2017): Finisar -16.2%; Q3 2017, FY outlook off expectations
     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM | 26 Comments
  • SALM

    Salem Media EPS of $0.11

    • Salem Media (NASDAQ:SALM): Q4 EPS of $0.11 may not be comparable to consensus of $0.15.
    • Revenue of $70.7M (+2.2% Y/Y) beats by $1.63M.
    • Shares +2.2% AH.
    • Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 4:25 PM
  • FNSR

    Finisar -16.2%; Q3 2017, FY outlook off expectations

    • Q3 2017 results – revenue $380.59M (+23.1% Y/Y, $8.96M below estimates), EPS $0.59 ($0.03 below estimates), gross margin 37% (vs. 37.2% Q/Q), operating expenses $70.5M (vs. $69.4M Q/Q), operating margin 18.5% (unchanged sequentially), cash, cash equivalents and short-term investments $1.2B (+$588M Q/Q)
    • FY 2017 projections – revenue $360M-$380M (consensus $393.42M), EPS $0.50-$0.56 (consensus $0.58) operating margin 17%
    • After hours – (NASDAQ:FNSR) $29.24
    • Press release / conference call
     
     
     
     
    | 4:16 PM | 21 Comments
  • FMSA

    Fairmount Santrol -16% on Q4 results; frac sand firms down sharply

    • Fairmount Santrol (FMSA -16.8%) sinks on much higher than normal volume after posting a wider than expected Q4 loss on a 4% Y/Y drop in revenue to $140.5M, also below analyst consensus.
    • FMSA does not provide sales and earnings guidance for 2017, citing volatility and uncertainty in oil and gas markets, but says it sees signs of continuing improvement in proppant volumes, mix and pricing.
    • Other frac sand names also are sharply lower: SLCA -6%, HCLP -15.6%, EMES -10.2%, SND -11.6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:30 PM | 5 Comments
  • ACOR

    Acorda Therapeutics up 7% on patent ruling

    • The company has won Patent Office rulings on all four Ampyra (dalfampridine) patents.
    • ACOR +7%
    • Update: Hedge fund honcho Kyle Bass was the challenger through his Coalition for Affordable Drugs. The USPTO ruled that the information he used to support his petition was not publicly available so it could not be used to invalidate the patents. If he had prevailed, though, there are additional patents protecting Ampyra through 2026.
    • The Coalition has filed more than 24 petitions challenging drug patents. Earlier this week, it filed three new ones directed at patents covering Insys Therapeutics' (INSY -1%) pain med Subsys (fentanyl). In about a month, the USPTO's Patent Trial and Appeal Board will decide whether to allow an inter partes review of patents covering two Shire (SHPG +0.1%) drugs, ulcerative colitis med Lialda (mesalamine) and Gattex (teduglutide [rDNA origin]) for short bowel syndrome.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:16 PM

  • Technology - Top Gainers / Losers as of 3:00 pm

    • Gainers: CMTL +22%. MXPT +17%. CRCM +16%. QBAK +15%. FSNN +15%.
    • Losers: HEAR -24%. VNET -19%. NIHD -16%. OTC:PRKR -15%. PLUG -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:00 PM | 6 Comments
  • NNN

    Selloff in REITs accelerates

    • One day ahead of the February employment report and less than a week before the FOMC hikes rates again, the 10-year Treasury yield has taken out its 2017 high, rising to 2.60%.
    • The major averages are just modestly lower, but IYR is down 1.4% and VNQ 1.5%. Both of the popular ETFs are now in the red for the year.
    • National Retail (NNN -1.7%), Welltower (HCN -2%), Medical Properties Trust (MPW -2.4%), Gramercy Property (GPT -2.2%), Aimco (AIV -1.5%), American Homes 4 Rent (AMH -2.7%), GGP (GGP -2.6%), Retail Opportunity (ROIC -1.9%), CubeSmart (CUBE -2.4%), Boston Properties (BXP -1.5%), Pebblebrook Hotel (PEB -2.4%), Liberty Property (LPT -1.4%), American Campus (ACC -2.2%), Armour Residential (ARR -1.2%), Chimera Investment (CIM -1.1%)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:41 PM | 71 Comments
  • ERF

    Enerplus to sell Alberta, Saskatchewan properties for C$67.3M

    • Overlooked amid today's flurry of sales activity among Canadian oil firms, Enerplus (ERF -6.7%) agrees to sell properties in Alberta and Saskatchewan for C$67.3M, including most of its shallow gas assets and the Brooks waterflood property.
    • ERF says it could realize a C$0.60/boe reduction of overall operating expense, improving the margin and reducing the overall well count.
    • With minimal capital allocated to the divested assets, ERF says its 2017 capital budget remains unchanged.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM | 3 Comments
  • TDG

    TransDigm active on new Citron report

    • "The cover up is on," tweets Citron Research, which updates its bear case on TransDigm (NYSE:TDG). Citron sees downside for the stock at $140 vs. the current $240.
    • TDG knee-jerked lower on the news, but has since returned to its pre-tweet price, roughly flat on the session.
    • Full report
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM

  • Energy/Materials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 pm

    • Gainers: SDRL +9%. MFCB +9%. NGS +8%. FGP +7%. CNQ +7%.
    • Losers: FMSA -23%. HCLP -16%. TDW -14%. SND -13%. TELL -12%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • SNP

    Sinopec to increase fine chemicals investment at Maoming refining hub

    • Sinopec (SNP -1.9%) says it plans to increase spending in fine chemicals at its Maoming-Zhanjiang refining base in southern China alongside partners including BASF (OTCQX:BASFY +0.3%).
    • The investment would be part of the $29B the state-owned group plans to spend upgrading its refining and petrochemical hubs by 2020.
    • Under the Maoming-Zhanjiang base, the 400K bbl/day Maoming refinery would focus on traditional fuel and fine chemicals, while the Zhanjiang greenfield project would produce clean fuels and have a heavier focus on fine chemicals.
    • SNP is considered better positioned than rival PetroChina (PTR -1.2%) in chemical markets because it has more facilities and better geographic locations.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:58 PM
  • AMX

    America Movil facing 65-day deadline on fixed-line company split

    • America Movil (NYSE:AMX) will need to act quickly to split off part of Telmex, according to Mexico's telecom regulator.
    • Adding detail to plans to step up antitrust enforcement, Mexico's Federal Telecommunications Institute says the country's leading telecom will have 65 working days to present its plan for the legal separation of part of its fixed-line subsidiary.
    • Company shares are down 4.9% on the day, trimming 2017 gains to 1.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:49 PM
  • WATT

    Oppenheimer & Co. reissues Energous at Perform

    • Subsequent Energous' (WATT -3.2%) Q4 2016 reporting, analyst Andrew Uerkwitz notes visibility on end-game possibilities remains, though at present levels, considers risk-reward balanced.
    • Yesterday (March 8, 2017): Energous -9%; Q4 2016 off expectations / earnings call transcript
    • Previously (January 24, 2017): Energous downgraded to Perform at Oppenheimer & Co.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:28 PM | 81 Comments
  • KMI

    Kinder Morgan hikes Trans Mountain cost, shipping commitments slip

    • Kinder Morgan (KMI -1.6%) slides after raising its cost estimate for the Trans Mountain pipeline expansion to C$7.4B (US$5.48B) from a C$6.8B estimate last month.
    • KMI attributes the higher project cost to several factors, including costs associated with the National Energy Board’s 157 conditions and project changes due to public feedback such as thicker pipe wall, additional drilled crossings in environmentally sensitive areas and the Burnaby Mountain tunnel.
    • KMI says shipping commitment for the project fell by 3%, or 22K bbl/day, after raising tolls, and the capacity will be offered to the industry again starting today through an open season process; the remaining 97% of the firm volumes are under contract with existing or new shippers.
    • RBC Capital analysts say the cost estimate is within expectations and that the shipper stats are a “net neutral to slight positive,” and they continue to expect KMI to generate a return of ~6.5x EV/EBITDA on the project given the tariff adjustment.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:26 PM | 16 Comments
  • NSPR

    InspireMD down 35% on equity offering

    • InspireMD (NSPR -34.5%) is getting roughed up on over 4x higher volume in response to its "best efforts" public offering of 1,171,875 shares of Series C Convertible Preferred Stock, Series B warrants and Series C warrants.
    • Each share of Series C Preferred is convertible into four common shares at $1.60 each.
    • Series B warrants, with a term of five years, are immediately exercisable to purchase up to 4,687,500 shares of common at $2.00.
    • Series C warrants, with a term of six months, are immediately exercisable to purchase up to 4,687,500 shares of common at $1.60.
    • Gross proceeds are expected to be ~$7.5M. Net proceeds will fund the expansion of sales and marketing activities supporting CGuard and MGuard Prime EPS.
    • Yesterday's close was $1.97.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:10 PM

  • Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM

    • Gainers: AGM +14%. NEWS +9%. ISTR +8%. MLP +7%. PN +7%.
    • Losers: CWH -8%. YRD -7%. SCM -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • IMMU

    Immunomedics' IMMU-132 deal on hold; shares rally 11%; Seattle Genetics down a fraction

    • Money flow was turned decidedly positive in Immunomedics (IMMU +10.7%) on the news that a Delaware court has barred the company from closing its out-license of IMMU-132 to Seattle Genetics (SGEN -0.2%). Investors believe that the newly reconstituted board, led by four venBio-backed candidates, will pursue a more financially attractive arrangement with SGEN.
    • Immunomedics management and venBio have been fighting over control of the company after it "gave away its crown jewel" to SGEN according to venBio.
    • Source: Bloomberg
    • Previously: Immunomedics perks up 1% on preliminary shareholder vote backing the election of four new directors (March 3)
    • Previously: Immunomedics plans to sue venBio to preserve Seattle Genetics deal for IMMU-132 (March 3)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:47 PM | 3 Comments

  • Midday Gainers / Losers

    • Gainers: OCRX +40%. CMTL +23%. ROIAK +22%. MXPT +19%. ICAD +17%. CRCM +16%. CRIS +16%. VVUS +15%. AGM +15%. ELF +14%.
    • Losers: NSPR -36%. TLRD -32%. OTC:CALI -22%. HEAR -20%. FMSA -19%. VNET -16%. TROV -14%. OTC:PRKR -14%. HZN -14%. HCLP -13%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:44 PM
  • STM

    STMicroelectronics -2.6% amid reports component supply timeline involving new iPhone extended

    • With Apple's tenth-anniversary iPhone model largely anticipated for fall release, speculation has STMicroelectronics' 3D image sensors in potentially delayed initial delivery regarding the device, with a "lag of several months" portended.
    • Quality of STMicroelectronics' components is noted (Bryan, Garnier & Co analyst Dorian Terral) as a non-issue, while longer-than-anticipated acceleration of the smartphone due to increasing technological complexities is reasoned.
    • STMicroelectronics (NYSE:STM) $15.19.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:43 PM | 1 Comment
  • NVO

    New Novo chief on the prowl for acquisitions to stoke growth

    • Novo Nordisk's (NVO +1.1%) new CEO Lars Fruergaard Jorgensen is aiming to make deals in order to recharge growth. In an interview today, he said, "Across our business we need to increasingly look for external innovation."
    • Global Blood Therapeutics (GBT +8.3%) has spiked ~33% since yesterday on reports that Novo was eyeing the blood disorder-focused biopharma firm. Mr. Jorgensen declined to comment on GBT but added, "We have strong relationships with hematologists and there could be other products that would be relevant for us to acquire and we are looking for that. Any deals would most likely be "bolt-ons" rather that anything very large. In my view, we should do smaller deals, low single-digit billions of dollars."
    • Shareholders will, no doubt, welcome the deal-making as shares have fallen over 40% since last summer.
    • Source: Reuters 
     
     
     
     
    | 12:36 PM | 15 Comments
  • TLRD

    Tailored Brands-Macy's tuxedo partnership falls flat

    • There's no question that the partnership between Tailored Brands (TLRD -31.4%) and Macy's (M -0.8%)  has been a disappointment. Tailored Brands CEO Doug Ewert explains below.
    • "We now believe that the tux rental opportunity with Macy’s is not likely to be as big as we initially thought."
    • "The results we’ve seen thus far have been disappointing. We anticipated start-up losses of $10 million during 2016 which grew $14 million due in part to most of our stores missing the bulk of the wedding season."
    • "We’ve agreed with Macy’s to put the opening of the additional contracted 130 stores on hold while we explore a potentially new model."
    • Tailored Brands earnings call transcript
     
     
     
     
    | 12:27 PM | 4 Comments
  • FIZZ

    National Beverage at all-time high after earnings

    • National Beverage (FIZZ +8.7%) jumps after the company reports FQ3 revenue increased 20% to $195M.
    • EPS arrives at $0.52 vs. $0.24 last year.
    • The company attributes its performance partially to the extra space being carved out by retailers for healthier products.
    • Shares of National Beverage reached an all-time high of $65.80 a few minutes ago.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:17 PM | 5 Comments
  • MDP

    Time +2.4% on reports its buyout price is over $20

    • Time Inc. (TIME) has gotten a midday boost, +2.4%, as Dow Jones reports that its price in this week's acquisition discussions has gone north of $20.
    • Shares are up to $19.20 now. The company has been going over acquisition bids and considering whether it might sell the whole company or individual media assets.
    • In the fall, the company reportedly rejected an $18/share offer from an investor group including Edgar Bronfman Jr. and media exec Ynon Kreiz. That group was said to be one of five final bidders this week, but reportedly has dropped out of the process as of last night.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:13 PM | 7 Comments

  • Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: ELF +14%. FIZZ +8%.
    • Losers: BORN -11%. VNCE -8%. KBSF -6%. DFBG-OLD -6%. BETR -5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:03 PM
  • NTR

    Fertilizer names higher as Belarus says ready to cooperate with Uralkali

    • Fertilizer stocks Potash Corp. (POT +2.4%), Agrium (AGU +2.3%) and Mosaic (MOS +0.9%) are higher following reports that the Belarus government is ready to cooperate with the Russians and Uralkali in making and selling fertilizers as long as the country's interests are secured.
    • BMO Capital analysts say Belarus Pres. Lukashenko has made similar pronouncements in the past and expects fertilizer names to give back today's gains when the market figures this out; shares already are well off session highs and some have turned lower - CF -1.1%, IPI -1.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 20 Comments
  • CLVS

    Positive late-stage data on AstraZeneca's Lynparza could stoke buying in Clovis says analyst; shares ahead 4%

    • Clovis Oncology (CLVS +3.5%) heads north on light volume. Morgan Stanley's Andrew Berens says buying could pick up in Clovis after AstraZeneca (AZN +0.5%) presents complete data from its Phase 3 SOLO-2 study assessing Lynparza (olaparib) in second-line ovarian cancer next week at the Society of Gynecologic Oncology meeting in National Harbor, MD. In October, the company announced that the trial was successful but did not release the specific results.
    • Clovis is expected to release top-line data by mid-year from its Phase 3 ARIEL3 study evaluating rucaparib after platinum-based chemo in ovarian, peritoneal or fallopian tube cancer.
    • Mr. Berens does not think the expected good news to have much of an impact on TESARO (TSRO -1%) since niraparib has broader activity and the company is fully valued.
    • Source: The Fly
    • Previously: AstraZeneca's Lynparza shows positive treatment benefit as monotherapy in late-stage study in treatment-resistant ovarian cancer (Oct. 26, 2016)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM | 6 Comments
  • ELF

    Valuation on e.l.f. Beauty in the spotlight

    • There's no question that e.l.f. Beauty (NYSE:ELF) is displaying red-hot sales growth in a vibrant category, but the proper valuation on the retailer is up for debate.
    • Cowen (Outperform, $34 PT): "We believe continued product innovation via a speedy supply chain, multi-channel distribution, & engaged customer base will drive upside thru FY17."
    • Morgan Stanley (Equalweight, $29 PT): The firm thinks the revenue growth projections are already baked into ELF's share price.
    • Piper Jaffray (Overweight, $34 PT): Points to the 50% increase in shelf space at Target and the prospect for other "distributiuon wins."
    • Wells Fargo: Boosts its valuation range to $28 to $30 from $26 to $28, noting earnings multiples are stretched.
    • Last October, SA contributor Don Dion recommended buying ELF after the quiet period expired.
    • Previously: e.l.f. Beauty beats by $0.05, beats on revenue (March 8)
    • Previously: Sizzling growth for e.l.f. Beauty, shares +21% (March 9)
    • Sources: StreetInsider and Bloomberg
     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM | 4 Comments
  • CRIS

    Curis up 15% on Q4 revenue beat

    • Curis (CRIS +14.9%) Q4 results ($M): Revenues: 2.4 (+18.4%).
    • Net Loss: (11.3) (+16.3%); Loss/Share: (0.08) (+20.0%).
    • Enrollment in Phase 1 study of CA-170 on track. Enrollment in Phase 2 of CUDC-907 in DLBCL study almost complete. INDs for CA-327 and CA-4948 expected this year.
    • Previously: Curis beats by $0.02, beats on revenue (March 9)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM | 1 Comment
  • EQIX

    Equinix opens ambitious data center in Brazil

    • Equinix (EQIX +3.2%) has opened a new data center in São Paulo, expanding its interconnection capabilities in Brazil and shoring up its position as home to the densest concentration of network carriers in the country.
    • The new $69M center, SP3, is an International Business Exchange Center, the company's fifth in Brazil.
    • Its first phase offers total capacity of 725 cabinets, and it will hit a total of 2,775 cabinets on completion, doubling the company's available space in Brazil. It has more than 215,000 square feet of gross space with about 13.3 MW of power available.
    • Equinix's São Paulo operations are a hub for about 1,000 companies, including 270 cloud and IT services companies and more than 70 telecom carriers.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:21 AM
  • GES

    Guess sinks to multi-year low amid more gloom

    • Shares of Guess (GES -5.5%) are down sharply after Mizuho warns on troubling traffic trends .
    • "We anticipate weakness in Americas retail and wholesale (~50% of sales) to overshadow green shoots in Asia and ongoing momentum in Europe. Besides our expectations for a guide shortfall, we also continue to question the strategy to rejuvenate the Americas segment and the multi-year retail store rollout strategy in Asia and Europe," reads the analyst note.
    • The firm moves to an Underperform rating on Guess on its view that the company's weak performance will continue. The price target goes to $10 from $14.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM

  • Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 pm

    • Gainers: OCRX +40%. VVUS +15%. CRIS +14%. XTLB +11%. PIRS +9%.
    • Losers: NSPR -37%. TROV -14%. TNDM -10%. MYOS -10%. CYCC -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:06 AM
  • CASY

    Northcoast Research turns cautious on Casey's General Stores

    • Casey's General Stores (CASY -0.3%) is slightly lower after Northcoast Research lowers its rating to Neutral from Buy.

  • CUR

    Preclinical data on Neuralstem's NSI-566 shows strong engraftment in brain injury animal model; shares ahead 2% premarket

    • Thinly traded nano cap Neuralstem (NYSEMKT:CUR) perks up 2% premarket, albeit on only 800 shares, in response to its announcement of encouraging preclinical results for stem cell therapy candidate NSI-566. The data were published recently in the Journal of Neurotrauma.
    • In a rat model of penetrating ballistic-like brain injury (PBBI), NSI-566 transplanted 7 - 10 days after PBBI showed vigorous engraftment and long-term survival. There was evidence of neuronal differentiation after four months and axons (threadlike parts of nerve cells that conduct electrical impulses) from grafted cells extended a significant distance from the graft site.
    • Preclinical testing in ongoing.

  • MDGS

    First MUSE procedure completed in China; Medigus up 25% premarket

    • Thinly traded nano cap Medigus (NASDAQ:MDGS) is up 25% premarket on light volume in response to its announcement of the first successful MUSE procedure in China.
    • The MUSE system is a single-use transoral stapler that incorporates an ultrasonic sight and range finder and a micro ScoutCam CMOS camera, enabling a single doctor to perform an incisionless transoral fundoplication (a procedure to treat the anatomical cause of gastroesophageal reflux disease) (GERD).
    • Since the device does not require any incisions, there is much less discomfort for the patient during the procedure with hospital stays reduced by up to 50%.
    • MUSE is approved in the U.S., the EU, Canada, Israel and Turkey. The company is in the process of obtaining regulatory clearance in China.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:38 AM
